resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Appcelerator Modules
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Modules here.

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description: When trying to create an android module with the titanium CLI, an error occurs saying that the the android.py script cannot find the Google Api's and that there's no DEFAULT_API_LEVEL attribute.
fields.environment:
Mac Os 10.6 Snow Leopard
Android sdk updated to API level 14 - All google add-ons

comments.body:
It seems to be an error in androidsdk.py
The path for the addons directory given in line 96 doesn't match the ones where there actually installed on my computer. (problem with hyphens and underscores in "addon_google_apis_google_inc_". I had to switch to "addon-google_apis-google_inc-"

Greg

I'm sorry to have missed this one. This was resolved in Titanium 1.8.0.1. Closing as fixed.

Cheers
Fixed by TIMOB-6135. Installing 1.8.0.1 resolves this issue.
